Trial_Design.evidence: treatment allocation was assigned randomly through blinded envelope

Participants.evidence: All patients undergoing primary TKA by one of the two study surgeons (GV, JP) during a 6-month period were evaluated for inclusion and invited to participate.

Intervention.evidence: The study group consisted of 10 patients whose components were implanted using a commercially prepared low-dose tobramycin bone cement mixture (1 g/40 g). The control group consisted of five patients who received standard weight-based dose intravenous tobramycin.

Objective.evidence: We asked: (1) What is the tobramycin serum and knee intraarticular levels in patients undergoing primary TKA using tobramycin cement? (2) What is the intraarticular tobramycin level for patients receiving only intravenous tobramycin?

Method_Outcome.evidence: Samples of serum and Hemovac ® drain-collected intraarticular hematoma were analyzed at 6, 24, and 48 hours postoperatively.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: treatment allocation was assigned randomly through blinded envelope

Blinding.evidence: treatment allocation was assigned randomly through blinded envelope

Number_Randomised.evidence: The study enrolled 15 patients undergoing primary TKA by one of two surgeons (GV, JP) who met inclusion criteria

Result_Outcome.evidence: The median (interquartile range [IQR]) intraarticular tobramycin concentrations for the study group, with tobramycin-impregnated bone cement, was 31.8 (29.0) μg/mL at 6 hours, 17.1 (13.1) μg/mL at 24 hours, and 6.8 (6.8) μg/mL at 48 hours.
